names.english: move the blood and induce sleep decoction
names.commonEnglish: Move the Blood and Induce Sleep Decoction

actions: Forcefully breaks up Blood Stasis and regulates Qi.
Activates Blood circulation, dispels Blood Stasis and regulates Qi.
With San Leng, for Qi and Blood Stagnation.
Spreads Liver Qi and relieves Stagnation.
With Bai Shao, for Liver Blood Deficiency with Liver Qi Stagnation.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
With Bai Shao, Dang Gui, Bai Zhu and Chai Hu, for hypochondriac pain due to Liver Qi Stagnation.
Nourishes the Blood and calms Liver Yang and Liver Wind.
With Zhi Gan Co, regulates the relationship between the Liver and Spleen.
With Chai Hu, for flank pain due to Liver Qi Stagnation.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, dries Dampness and promotes water metabolism.
Nourishes Heart Yin, tonifies Liver Blood and calms the Spirit.
Tonifies, activates and harmonizes the Blood.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood.
With Chai Hu and Bai Shao, for Liver Qi Stagnation and Blood Deficiency.
Quiets the Heart, calms the Spirit and soothes the nerves.
Nourishes the Heart Yin and Blood and calms the Spirit.
With Fu Shen, calms the Spirit.
Activates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, clears Heat, soothes irritability, nourishes the Blood and calms the Spirit.
Calms the Liver, anchors the Yang, sedates fright and calms the Spirit.
Activates the Blood
Breaks up Stasis
Regulates Qi
Nourishes the Blood
Calms the Liver
Calms the Shen

symptoms: Sides and ribs distended on both sides (maybe with sharp pain)
Enlargement of the Liver and Spleen
Breast distention and pain before and during menses
manifestations.tongue: Dark purple (maybe purple spots on edge of tongue)
